communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2025-ICFO-25063
communications.communication:
09/15/2025 

Andrew  Free 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR182986 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA 2025-ICFO-25063 
 
Dear Requester: 

This email is in response to your status inquiry regarding ICE FOIA 2025-ICFO-25063, in which you have requested all records pertaining to IHSC Mortality Review for Brendy Yohana Bamaca-Zacarais, who died in ICE Custody September 7, 2024, according to the Detainee Death Report ICE published: https://www.ice.gov/doclib/foia/reports/ddrBrendyYohanaBamacaZacarias.pdf. 

As of today, your request has been assigned to a processor and your request is being reviewed. If responsive records have been located, they will be reviewed for a determination of releasability. 

ICE FOIA apologizes for the delay in the processing of your request. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 

If you have any questions, please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Daniel Edgington at the address above or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2025-ICFO-25063. Please use this number in future correspondence. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2025-ICFO-25063
communications.communication:
Good morning, 

FOIA requires the agency to make a determination within 20 working days, and to provide an estimated date of production. Can ICE do either of these things? 

Many thanks, 

Andrew Free

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide copies of all cease-and-desist letters and enforcement notices issued to farms, wineries, and agricultural or agri-tourism businesses—including but not limited to Nostrano Vineyards, Bad Seed, Fjord Vineyard, Quartz Rock Winery, Quartz Rock Cider House, Locust Grove Brewing Company, Raspberry Fields Farms, and Weed Orchards—within the Town of Marlborough between June 1, 2025 and August 15, 2025.

Please also include any letters or notices currently pending issuance to farms, wineries, or other agricultural or agri-tourism establishments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ann Casey

title: First Amendment Trainings for Law-Enforcement Officers (Denver Police Department)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: First Amendment Trainings for Law-Enforcement Officers (Denver Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any materials or programming (including handouts, slideshows, videos, textbooks, or other media) used in connection with providing training or guidance to law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the following subjects: (a) The First Amendment; (b) protests or demonstrations; (c) freedom of speech or expression; (d) filming police officers. This request is limited to materials used in trainings since January 1, 2020.

2. Any policy concerning whether trainings on the topics mentioned in (1) are mandatory, or regulating the frequency of such trainings.

3. A copy of any document sufficient to show the most recent training conducted for law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the subjects in (1). For example, this could be a receipt or contract for an outside vendor or speaker, or it could be a dated sign-in sheet from the training.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Police disciplinary files (Cowlitz County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Cowlitz County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aspen Ford

communications.communication:

Thank you for your interest in public records of Cowlitz County. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was created on 7/13/2025 and given the reference number C003897-071325 for tracking purposes.  The date your request is received within our office will be calculated based on our department's normal business hours and days of operation. 
 Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aspen Ford

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcowlitz-county-prosecuting-attorney-35585%252Fpolice-disciplinary-files-cowlitz-county-prosecuting-attorney-189434%252F%253Femail%253Dprosecutor%252540cowlitzwa.gov&url_auth_token=AAGs-lk5FblW52Xlzl53un8wZH4%3A1ub9O5%3AIpgii-2lpumoIU6AXLbLnTtw7MUB2VSLwh3odJgC52M 
 
You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed.  Please use the portal to respond to emails, ask questions, and follow the progress of your request. 
 
Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
 
Cowlitz County

communications.subject: Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Aspen  Ford, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Cowlitz County Public Records Center 
 
Your Login ID is:  189434-49589259@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://cowlitzcountywa.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx)

Hello,

Thank you for sending me you all's Brady List. I wanted to ask if you all have any records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law as it relates to the officers on the list you sent? This was included in my initial request and I just wanted to make sure these were included as well if you all have maintain those records too.

Thank you for your time,

Aspen Ford

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #C003897-071325
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you all again for sending over your Brady List. I had a couple of follow-up questions. Could you please verify that LPD is Longview Police Department and which police departments are 'KPD' and 'WPD'? I am sending out Brady list records requests across the state and I am not familiar with Cowlitz County. Thanks for your help!

Also, I wanted to ask if you have on-hand any police reports or misconduct records for the officers on your Brady list. Some counties keep these on hand and I was hoping to get those records as well as it was a part of my initial request.

Thank you for your time,
Aspen

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #C003897-071325
communications.communication:
Apsen,
This response was sent though our public records portal, but wanted to make sure you received it directly as well.

July 31, 2025

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 13, 2025, Reference # C003897-071325

Dear Aspen Ford,

We received the communication from you below:
Thank you all again for sending over your Brady List. I had a couple of follow-up questions. Could you please verify that LPD is Longview Police Department and which police departments are 'KPD' and 'WPD'? I am sending out Brady list records requests across the state and I am not familiar with Cowlitz County. Thanks for your help!
Also, I wanted to ask if you have on-hand any police reports or misconduct records for the officers on your Brady list. Some counties keep these on hand and I was hoping to get those records as well as it was a part of my initial request.
Thank you for your time,
Aspen
To answer your questions, LPD is the acronym for Longview Police Department.  KPD is Kelso Police Department and WDP is Woodland Police Department.
Additionally, after further review of your request as well as our records, we are reopening your request and are in the process of reviewing and releasing the police report and/or misconduct records for the officers on our Brady list.   We estimate the next installment to this request will be available on or before 08/14/2025.  If public records become available in advance of this estimate we will contact you promptly. Conversely, if the county encounters a need to extend our estimate, we will contact you promptly with a revised estimated date.

If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to contact my office at 360-577-3020 ext. 6709.   In the future for faster assistance, either respond through the records portal or email myself or the public records team at PublicRecords@cowlitzwa.gov

Sincerely,


[Logo  Description automatically generated]Shanie Searing
Public Records Analyst
207 N 4th Avenue, Rm 305
Kelso, WA 98626
P. (360) 577-3020 ext. 6709
Searing.Shanie@cowlitzwa.gov<mailto:Searing.Shanie@cowlitzwa.gov>

  Cowlitz County Washington 
 

August 12, 2025 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 13, 2025, Reference # C003897-071325 
Dear Aspen Ford, 
The County received a public records request from you on July 13, 2025. You requested the following: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States. 
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Aspen Ford

The purpose of this letter is to notify you that we need to adjust our time estimate for your next installment in response to your public records request, C003897-071325. 
We had originally estimated that the third installment of records would be available on or before 09/11/2025.  However, we need additional time and will need to extend this date.  We estimate your next installment of records will be made available on or about 10/09/2025.  Please note this is an estimate and if records become available prior to this date, we will notify you.  In addition, if we need to adjust and extend this deadline further, we will promptly notify you of this adjustment.

Sincerely,

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any signed and/or executed employment contract/agreement/offer letter/memorandum of understanding between Arkansas State University and Nick Carroll.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Ellen.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Diplomatic Intercepts - Romania
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of FBI file 65-HQ-57411, on the interception of diplomatic communications from the Romanian government during World War II.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1433170-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: FOIA# 1433170-000/ 065-HQ-57411
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Mr. Galante,

This is in reference to your FOIPA request # 1433170-000 for FBI records concerning 065-HQ-57411. We are reaching out to you to determine if you are still interested in these records, or, if at this time, you would consider reducing the size of your request.

Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis. Requests are divided into two primary tracks -simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents). Complex requests are further divided into medium (51-500 pages), large (501-4,999 pages), and extra-large (5,000 and over pages) sub-tracks are based upon request size.

Your request is currently in the large track and reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing, allow for a timelier receipt of the information you seek, and reduce the duplication costs, if applicable.

Please contact us with regards to this inquiry to let us know if you are still interested in receiving records for this request either in full (the remaining records), or reducing the request to a faster processing track.
If you reduce the size, you may request remaining, additional records by submitting a new FOIPA request upon completion of this one.

Respectfully,

Negotiation Team
Federal Bureau of Investigation
Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>

Status Checks: https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps | foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>
For additional information, please visit the www.fbi.gov/foia<http://www.fbi.gov/foia> website.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1433170-000
communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Galante,

Thank you for your email inquiry.

Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.
Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system. Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents). Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size. Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process. Small track requests (0-50 pages) current average time is approximately 4 months to complete; Medium track requests (51-500 pages) current average time is approximately 41 months to complete; Large track requests (501-4,999 pages) current average time is approximately 67 months to complete; and Extra-large track requests (over 5,000 pages) current average time is approximately 79 months to complete.


Respectfully,

Negotiation Team
Federal Bureau of Investigation
Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>

Status Checks: https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps | foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>
For additional information, please visit the www.fbi.gov/foia<http://www.fbi.gov/foia> website.

communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 122 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,230 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,370 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1433170-000
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a follow-up for FOIA request 1433170-000 and your email sent on February 18, 2025. Payment in the amount of $26.50 has been sent for this request as of today. I apologize for the delay; there is normally an auotmated alert on MuckRock for any payments needed, for whatever reason it was not triggered when the most recent interirm response letter was received. As you are likely aware, I am a frequent requester, and I use the tools this platform provides to keep on top of them. In light of this error, I will be checking interim release letters more closely in the future so this does not happen again.

Sincerely,
Paul Galante

title: Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) Records Request (San Jose Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) Records Request (San Jose Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

We request the following records related to Automated License Plate Readers ("ALPRs") and your law enforcement agency ("Agency").
Part A - Information related to ALPR data sharing.
A1. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shared ALPR data in 2025;
A2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency received ALPR data in 2025;
A3. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information in 2025;
A4. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information in 2025.
The information requested in items A1-A4 is readily available for extraction through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Data Sharing Report function. With Flock Safety, this information is available through the transparency portal function.
Most agencies have encountered little difficulty in providing this information (see below). In a small number of cases, an agency has interpreted items A1-A4 as requesting the creation of a record that does not exist. We disagree: this data is maintained by your software, can be exported through software your agency has already purchased, and is therefore subject to CPRA.
However, should you disagree, you may alternatively produce the following records:
A5. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents that external agencies have signed to comply with Sec 1798.90.52(b) for accessing your agency's ALPR data. These documents are also often required under the "Releasing ALPR Data" subsection of a California law enforcement agency's SB 34 policy.
A6. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents that your agency has signed pursuant to Sec 1798.90.52(b) to access other agencies' ALPR data.
A7. All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods June 5th, 2024 until the date of processing this request.
Items A5-A7 are not necessary if your agency provides the information requested in items A1-A4. We feel that items A1-A4 are more focused and would require less labor from your agency to produce.
Part B - Information Related to Numbers of “Detections” (plate scans) and “Hits” (plate scans that matched to a hotlist)
B1. The aggregate number of "detections" collected during 2025.
B2. The aggregate number of “hits” during 2025.
B3. The aggregate number of "detections" from June 5th, 2024 until the date this request is processed.  If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. For example, most Flock Safety systems may not have this data beyond 30 days.
B4. The aggregate number of “hits” from June 5th, 2024 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. 
B5. Average Daily Scans based on the past amount of days in which you retain data.
The information requested in items B1-B4 is readily available through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Hit Ratio Report function. With Flock Safety, this information is available through the transparency portal function. As noted above, this information exists within your system and can be easily exported with existing software.
Part C - Assistance, Description, and Recommendations.
We make the following requests under section 6253.1 of the California Public Records Act
C1. A description of the information technology and physical location in which the records exist.
C2. Assist us identifying records and information that will help the public understand how ALPR data and hotlists are shared, how much data is collected year-to-year, and how much of that data matches a hot list; and
C3. Provide suggestions for overcoming any practical basis for denying access to the information sought.
Please note that more than 80 California law enforcement agencies have provided the information requested in Parts A1-A4 and B1-B4 in previous years. For your reference we have included a PDF below with the names of the agencies that have historically provided these records.
(This URL links to a dataset with links to the records: https://www.eff.org/document/data-driven-2-california-dragnet-data-set)
Part D - Information Related to New Changes
D1. Flock Safety has announced that they are building a product called Flock Nova, which combines information from agencies into one place, such as “Unify CAD, RMS, video, LPR, and public records.” It is mentioned in this article (https://www.404media.co/license-plate-reader-company-flock-is-building-a-massive-people-lookup-tool-leak-shows/) that the tool is being used by some law enforcement agencies in an early access program (https://www.flocksafety.com/devices/flock-nova#:~:text=Flock%20Nova%20Early%20Access%20Now%20Open). Is/was your Agency part of, invited to, or booked a demo for the early access program? Is/has your Agency utilized Flock Nova? If yes, have you used the tool in any police investigations?
D2. Please send a document of the most up-to-date ALPR policy that your Agency uses.
Part E – Information Related to ALPR Camera Locations
E1. The location (address, intersection, coordinates, or nearest landmark) of each ALPR camera operated, maintained, or accessed by the Agency as of the date of this request.
E2. If your agency uses mobile ALPR cameras (e.g., on patrol cars), please indicate how many mobile units are currently deployed, and describe any policies that govern how locations of scans from mobile units are logged or stored.
E3. If exact addresses or coordinates are withheld, please provide general placement descriptions (e.g., "fixed camera at Main St & 2nd Ave," or "mobile ALPR unit assigned to Northern District patrol vehicle").
This information is typically accessible within ALPR system management software. For example:
- In Flock Safety camera location information is visible through the camera dashboard and deployment maps.
- In Vigilant/Motorola, camera locations are often listed in the device management or configuration settings.
Part F - ALPR Vendor Contracts and Purchase Agreements
F1. All contracts, purchase orders, service agreements, statements of work, or memoranda of understanding between the Agency and any vendor of ALPR technology (including Flock Safety, Vigilant Solutions/Motorola, etc.) in effect during January 1, 2024–June 5, 2025. 
F2. All invoices, receipts, and payment records related to the purchase, installation, operation, or maintenance of ALPR systems during January 1, 2024–June 5, 2025. 
F3. Any grant applications or grant award documents (e.g., from DHS, DOJ, or private foundations) that funded or supported the acquisition or expansion of ALPR systems.
Part G – Internal Communications and Rationale for Placement
G1. Any internal memos, emails, reports, or presentations from 2022–2025 discussing where ALPR cameras should be placed or were ultimately placed. This includes communications from officers, command staff, city officials, or vendor representatives regarding:
- Placement location recommendations
- Crime statistics or justifications used to determine placement
- Community concerns or opposition
- Equity or privacy impacts
- “High crime” area designations or related targeting rationale
G2. Any communications with Flock Safety, Vigilant Solutions, or other ALPR vendors from 2022–2025 regarding camera placement, pilot programs, early access programs, or system expansion.
CPRA requires you to undertake reasonable efforts to locate responsive records and to work in good faith with requesters to respond to their request. See CYAC v. City of National City, 220 Cal.App.4th 1385, 1430 (2013). Thus under the CPRA you are obligated to conduct a reasonable search and cannot deny a request merely because it might generate a large volume of records.
We ask that you please respond to this request within 10 days either by providing all the requested records or by providing a written response setting forth the legal authority on which you rely in withholding or redacting any document, as well as stating when documents will be made available. Should you choose to withhold or reject this request, we ask that you provide an explanation of why your agency is responding differently compared to the many others that have complied with our request.
Part H – ALPR Audit Logs & Access Records (More Detail)
H1. A list of all ALPR database users employed by the Agency between June 5, 2024 and the present, including job titles, divisions, and access levels. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. 
H2. Audit logs showing ALPR database access by Agency personnel from June 5, 2024 to the present. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period.  Please include:
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the date above, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.
- Date and time of access
- Name and Job Title of User
- Search parameters (e.g., plate number or geographic query)
- Stated reason for access, if logged
2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period from the date above, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.
These logs are required under California Civil Code § 1798.90.52(a) and can help determine how often ALPR data is being queried and by whom. These records have been disclosed by several agencies in prior CPRA requests.
If the records responsive to any part of this request are held by another department, division, or city office (such as the Mayor’s Office, Department of Technology, SFMTA, or a surveillance oversight board), please identify the appropriate custodian or refer this request accordingly, as required under Government Code § 6253.1.
In particular, if your agency does not maintain records related to:
- The policy rationale or decision-making process for camera placement
- Contracts or procurement related to ALPR vendors
- Surveillance technology policy
Please inform me which department or office may hold these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Omar Solis

communications.subject: CUSTOMER - New Customer Welcome Message

Thank you for registering with the City of San Jose Records Center.  If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you. 
 Your Login ID is:  187612-25213989@requests.muckrock.com

(This URL links to a dataset with links to the records: https://www.eff.org/document/data-driven-2-california-dragnet-data-set)

H2. Audit logs showing ALPR database access by Agency personnel from June 5, 2024 to the present. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. Please include:
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the date above, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.
- Date and time of access
- Name and Job Title of User
- Search parameters (e.g., plate number or geographic query)
- Stated reason for access, if logged
2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period from the date above, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Omar Solis

title: Flock Safety Devices List (Loveland CO Police Department}

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Flock Safety Devices List (Loveland CO Police Department}
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:

Flock networks shared with me Devices List (Please see https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2022/11/17/CPRA_REQUEST.pdf
https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2022/11/09/1938_001.pdf as examples of the lists from other jurisdictions.

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Swatting Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Documents, memos, presentations, and emails (including attachments) written between January 1, 2020 and the date this request is processed regarding a spree of false reports of active shooting incidents called into schools and universities. A keyword search could include the words "hoax", "hoax call", "swatting", "false report" AND the words "school" or "university"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-IAFO-00282
communications.communication:
You have reached SecureRelease™ Support.

The purpose of this inbox is to provide technical support for the SecureRelease FOIA Request Portal website (https://www.securerelease.us/).



SecureRelease Support is not involved with the processing or prioritization of FOIA requests, and our staff cannot answer questions related to request status, expected timelines, or agency procedures. To ask for an update or discuss the specifics of your request(s), you must contact the agency directly.


If you submitted your request(s) through the SecureRelease™ Request Portal<https://www.securerelease.us/> or to a participating agency using FOIA.gov, you may use SecureRelease Portal Messages to send electronic correspondence and attachments directly to the agency.



To send a portal message:



  1.  Sign in to the SecureRelease™ Request Portal: https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/
  2.  Click the My Requests icon
  3.  Locate the request you wish to inquire about, and click on the Request Number
  4.  From the request screen, click the Messages icon at the top of the page
  5.  Click the Add Message button at the upper right
  6.  Complete the required Message Fields
  7.  Drag and drop any Files you wish to attach into the file upload box (Optional)
     *   Maximum of 25 files can be attached to a message, and total file size cannot be more than 100 mb. Supported file formats: DOC, DOCX, XLS, XLSX, TXT, PDF, JPG, PNG, BMP and TIF/TIFF
  8.  Click Send
  9.  Return to the Messages tab within your Request to access outgoing and incoming messages


Should you have an inquiry related to your SecureRelease user account or concerning www.securerelease.us<http://www.securerelease.us>, please email us with the relevant details and a member of our support team will be happy to assist.



Take care,


SecureRelease™ Support Team
securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com<mailto:securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com>
www.securerelease.us<https://www.securerelease.us/>

title: Banned books list (Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Banned books list (Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

Thank you for your interest in public records of the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation (CDCR). Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the California Public Records Act, Government Code section 7920.000 et seq. Your request was received on September 08, 2025 and given the reference number I032099-090825 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

PLEASE NOTE: The California Public Records Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions.

California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the CDCR PUBLIC RECORDS PORTAL

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Scholarship Criteria
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of scholarships available to VMI Cadets from any source and the selection criteria for those scholarships (needs-based, athletic, merit, or other). There are only a few listed on your website, yet your website and the Alumni Agencies material indicate there are a number of them available, and even for the Alumni Agencies-funded scholarships, VMI makes or participates in the selections. This makes the information releasable under the FOIA.  If there is a website that lists these, I am willing to pull them from there, but unlike almost every other Virginia IHE, VMI does not have an easily locatable source for this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request ##25-120
communications.communication:
Thank you for the prompt response to my FOIA request. Can you please provide the following so that I understand the data?

 Meaning of the field titles and associated letter codes: "Award", "Need Cost", "Category", "Type" and "destination". for example,  the "need cost" uses codes like "C", "E", "N", etc. but there sheet does not contain any explanation for what those codes mean.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request ##25-120
communications.communication: Also I noticed that the two new scholarships VMI publicized in honor of Maj. Gen. Wins are not listed. Are they under another name I missed?

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Virginia Military Institute public records request #25-120
communications.communication:
Virginia Military Institute ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-120: Column A = The award code we use to differentiate the awards Column B = The description of the award Column C = Need/Cost/SAI (EFC) - is it need-based, cost-based, FC (federal) or E not counted towards their financial aid budget Column D = self-help (not used for anything) Column E = Category, SCH means scholarship Column F = Type: F = federal, I = institutional, S = state, O = other  Column G = destination (used for award transmitting purposes only and how the funds are applied to the bill) ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Virginia Military Institute.

Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: TX mDL Program Records (Jan 2023–Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Planning documents, feasibility studies, pilot proposals, implementation roadmaps, and any vendor marketing materials or brochures provided to the agency, as well as internal deliberations about whether or how to move forward with an mDL program, created between January 1, 2023 and the present.

Agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with vendors or partners, including but not limited to AAMVA, IDEMIA, Thales, GET Group, Apple, Google, Samsung, or other providers.

Interagency or interstate coordination documents, including but not limited to MOUs or correspondence with AAMVA or other states or Dallas/Fort Worth Int’l Airport regarding mDL interoperability or standards development.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of September 01, 2025., Reference # P018953-090125. 
Dear Rebecca Williams, 
The Texas Department of Public Safety received a public information request from you on September 01, 2025. Your request mentioned: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Planning documents, feasibility studies, pilot proposals, implementation roadmaps, and any vendor marketing materials or brochures provided to the agency, as well as internal deliberations about whether or how to move forward with an mDL program, created between January 1, 2023 and the present. 

Agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with vendors or partners, includ" 
Please log into the system to retrieve the information located in response to your request. 
DPS has located other records responsive to your request; however, we believe these records may be excepted from required public disclosure at this time.  DPS is seeking a ruling from the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) with respect to disclosure of these records, and a copy of our request letter is attached.  You will be notified directly by the OAG when a ruling is issued. 
If you have any questions or need additional information, please submit your response through this portal. 
Sincerely, 
Brian Riemenschneider 
Assistant General Counsel 
OGC

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: BPD District Community CompStat Presentations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to G.L. c. 66, § 10, I request copies of all Community CompStat presentations prepared, displayed, or distributed by the Boston Police Department at Community CompStat meetings in any district during August and September 2025.

This request is an expansion of my prior request for the District E-13 Community CompStat presentation (August 26, 2025), which the Department fulfilled in full and which is now public via MuckRock: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/boston-3/bpd-district-e-13-community-compstat-presentation-aug-26-2025-192111/. That prior release confirms that such presentation materials are regularly prepared, used, and subject to disclosure under the Public Records Law.

By way of example, additional Community CompStat presentations were held in District D-4 (South End) on Aug 27th, and in other districts citywide during this August and September 2025 time period.  Feel free to exclude the Aug 26 E-13 presentation that has already been provided if it makes it easier for you. 

Please provide the complete presentation materials (e.g., PowerPoint, slide deck, PDF, or other format) as displayed at each meeting.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

That prior release confirms that such presentation materials are regularly prepared, used, and subject to disclosure under the Public Records Law. 

By way of example, additional Community CompStat presentations were held in District D-4 (South End) on Aug 27th, and in other districts citywide during this August and September 2025 time period. Feel free to exclude the Aug 26 E-13 presentation that has already been provided if it makes it easier for you. 

Please provide the complete presentation materials (e.g., PowerPoint, slide deck, PDF, or other format) as displayed at each meeting. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage. 

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Brian McCarter 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fboston-police-department-174%252Fbpd-district-community-compstat-presentations-192859%252F%253Femail%253Dshawn.williams%252540boston.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj3ZGMpK7GcwjUUAUtBlYljwA%3A1uwX9M%3AOqyDOJwFY5-o7QvGli04IOsRJRDZDwIluBgxqeyrgNs We have reviewed our files and have located records that correspond to your request. These records have been released to the Public Records Center . You may appeal this response to the Supervisor of Records in the Office of the Secretary of the Commonwealth. G. L. c. 66, § 10A (c); G. L. c. 66, § 10(b)(ix); 950 CMR 32.08; 950 CMR 32.08(1)(h) (in petitioning the Supervisor, the requester shall provide a copy of such petition to the records access officer associated with such petition).  You may also appeal to the Superior Court.  950 CMR 32.06(3)(c). Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request #B002529-091025
communications.communication:
Hi Attorney O’Donnell,

Thanks for the materials produced so far. Based on information I have, there are likely additional Community CompStat slide decks within the timeframe. To avoid piecemeal follow-ups and ensure a complete response, could you please clarify the search that has been conducted and confirm whether additional responsive records exist?

Specifically, please identify:

1. Custodians consulted
• Names or roles (e.g., district captains, Community Service Office, Command Staff, Office of Media Relations).
• Whether district calendars or shared drives were checked.


2. Systems/locations searched
• Email (Exchange/Outlook), Teams/SharePoint, RMS, department intranet/shared drives, district SharePoint sites, and any event/meeting calendar systems used to schedule Community CompStat meetings.
• For each system, the search terms/filters used (e.g., “CompStat,” “Community CompStat,” district codes) and the date ranges applied.


3. Scope across districts and dates
• Which districts and date ranges were included.
• Whether you looked for presentations, agendas, and handouts for all Community CompStat meetings in the period, not just a single date/district.

title: Library contract request: EBSCO eBooks at Wright State University

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Library contract request: EBSCO eBooks at Wright State University
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with EBSCO Information Services (EBSCO Industries, Inc. "EBSCO") relating to the licensing of EBSCO eBooks;

All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with EBSCO for e-book licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of EBSCO eBooks.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

smhc

title: Anthony Provenzale FOIA RequestLegal Secretary Position

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

City of Danbury CT Human Resources All applicant data related to the open position of legal secretary from 8/1/24 until 12//18/24. All information pertaining to applicant sex, race, creed and national origin. Any and all information concerning whom of anyone was hired Any and all information concerning any restructuring, including but not limited to eliminating the position of legal secretary. Any and all information concerning applicant Anthony Provenzale, for the position of legal secretary. Any and all information concerning interview notes, information, or details about Anthony Provenzale. Any and all information concerning Anthony Provenzale rank in the city of Danbury list of hiring for the position of legal secretary.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Provenzale

contact with you to arrange further details about how to obtain your
request. Thank you for your patience.

Kind regards.
Nelly

To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Connecticut Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 18, 2024. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Anthony Provenzale FOIA RequestLegal Secretary Position
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

City of Danbury CT Human Resources All applicant data related to the open position of legal secretary from 8/1/24 until 12//18/24. All information pertaining to applicant sex, race, creed and national origin. Any and all information concerning whom of anyone was hired Any and all information concerning any restructuring, including but not limited to eliminating the position of legal secretary. Any and all information concerning applicant Anthony Provenzale, for the position of legal secretary. Any and all information concerning interview notes, information, or details about Anthony Provenzale. Any and all information concerning Anthony Provenzale rank in the city of Danbury list of hiring for the position of legal secretary.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Request for Public Records Request Log
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request a copy of any logs, spreadsheets, or databases maintained by your office that track public records requests received, including (if available):

Date of request
Requester name
Summary or description of request
Response date
Disposition (granted, denied, etc.)
Fee charged, if any

If available, please provide the data in spreadsheet or machine-readable format (e.g., CSV or Excel).

Please provide 2024 and 2025.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

Our Case No.: R000926-072725 

Dear Mr. McCarter, 

Please find attached all public records requests received by the MBTA in 2024. Please note, due to a software error, the "fee charged" has defaulted to zero for each request. There were certain requests from 2024 where the MBTA did charge a fee. If you have questions about any particular request, please let us know. 

In addition, certain information has been redacted form this record, including dates of birth, license numbers, personal medical information, and the names of any injured parties. This information is exempt from disclosure under Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 4, Section 7(26) (c), which exempts materials or data “relating to a specifically named individual, the disclosure of which may constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy”. The MBTA has determined that the public interest in the release of this personal information does not outweigh the privacy interests of the individual(s) involved. To the extent that this information falls under the definition of “personal information” under M.G.L. c. 93H and 201 CMR 17.00, it must be  redacted. In addition, the disclosure of personal data is prohibited by the federal Fair Information Practices Act and Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 66, Section 2(c) which states, in part, that every holder maintaining personal data shall "not allow any other agency or individual not employed by the holder to have access to personal data unless such access is authorized by statute or regulations which are consistent with the purposes of this chapter..." 

Please be advised that in the case of a denial of access to records, you have the right to an administrative appeal to the Supervisor of Records, pursuant to 950 CMR 32.08(1) (the Code of Massachusetts Regulations), and the right to seek judicial review by commencing an action in the Superior Court. 

We will provide the 2025 requests running to the date of your public records request soon. 

Sincerely, 

Julie Ciollo 
Assistant General Counsel/ 
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Martin Theodore Orne
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a resulf of investigation or inquiry of Martin Theodore Orne (October 16, 1927 - February 11, 2000). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2000/02/17/us/martin-orne-72-psychiatrist-and-expert-on-hypnosis-dies.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Pike-VV
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents, memorandum, communications, reports, investigation findings, or files related to the Village Voice's February 16, 1976 publication of leaked information from the Congressional investigation into the CIA and the intelligence community.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Guariglia

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Traffic Arrests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the [State] Public Records Act, I request copies of police reports for all traffic stops conducted by the [Police Department] between August 1, 2025 and August 7, 2025 that resulted in an arrest. If no arrest please widen search from August 1, 2025 and August 31, 2025.

If the department cannot search by stop type, please instead provide:

The arrest log for the same dates; and The corresponding incident or arrest reports for those arrests that originated from a traffic stop.

Please provide these records in electronic format of PDF or Word/Excel. If any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, please redact only the exempt material and release all reasonably segregable portions of the record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Rights React

Good Morning,

See attached list of arrests related to your request. Going through each call and getting the report & redacting etc takes some time, so please let me know if you are interested in receiving specific report(s) for any of the listed call number.  

**Please respond via email to: police/clerks@whitehall-oh.us

Thank you,
