communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: BOE Contact Form Submissions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all submissions made through the Board of Education website contact form during the period from July 1, 2024 through the date of this request.

I understand that some submissions may contain information exempt from disclosure (e.g., student education records protected by under state/federal law, or personally identifying information). I respectfully request that any such information be redacted as necessary, rather than withholding the entire record.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Bellford

*Francine Coss*

communications.subject: Re: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: BOE Contact Form Submissions
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Bellford,

On behalf of the Thomaston Board of Education, I am writing to inform you
that the review of your request is completed. Please note that while
responsive records have been located, certain information is required by
law to be withheld. Specifically, the Connecticut Freedom of Information
Act and federal student privacy laws (including FERPA) mandate the
protection of personally identifiable information related to students, as
well as certain personal data related to staff. For this reason, redactions
were applied prior to release.

Additionally, the format in which the submissions are stored does not lend
itself to clean printing. The records have nonetheless been preserved in
their original form, with only the necessary redactions made to protect
students and staff.

We trust this clarifies the basis for the formatting and redaction in the
materials provided.

Sincerely,
Francine Coss


*Francine Coss*
Superintendent of Schools

*Thomaston Public Schools Mission Statement:*

In a partnership of family, school and community, our mission is to
*educate*, *challenge* and *inspire* each individual to excel and become a
contributing member of society.
*Thomaston Public Schools*
185 Branch Road
Thomaston, CT 06787
Phone: 860-283-3053
Fax: 860-283-3096
www.thomastonschools.org
@ThomastonBOE <https://twitter.com/ThomastonBOE>

legally privileged and is intended only for the recipient(s) named above.

original and any copies from your computer system.*

title: Untitled (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Greetings. I request copies of any memos, studies, or other such records dated Jan 1, 2020, through the date you complete your search, referencing (1) the Justice Department resources spent or expected to be spent litigating Freedom of Information Act cases or (2) the frequency with which the government has won or lost Freedom of Information Act cases.  I'm not looking for individual emails that happen to make mention of these subjects, but rather, more formal studies or other such records that are the results of a more formal evaluation.  I'm happy to discuss the scope with you.  By "resources" I mean the costs in terms of attorney/staff hours, FTEs, or salaries.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Topic

title: Mayday USA Tour (Seattle Office Of Special Events)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mayday USA Tour (Seattle Office Of Special Events)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am writing in regards to a pair of public demonstrations and protests which occurred in Seattle last week. 
The first event was held in Cal Anderson Park on Saturday, May 24th. A second, followup event was held outside of City Hall on Tuesday, May 27th.
For the purposes of identifying the correct party and records, the event's original registration page can be found here: https://www.maydayusa.co/

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

* Permits and related application materials submitted to (or issued by) your department, including any attachments, maps, or forms, for either of the above events. 
     * If multiple venues were considered, I would like the relevant records for each of them.

* All correspondence (including emails, letters, and internal memos) between:
     * Your department and the organizers or any representatives of these events.
     * Your department and any other city department, specifically in regards to these events.
     * Internal communications within your department that relate to the planning, permitting, or management of these events.

Please include any records dated between January 1st, 2025, and June 1st, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth Haste

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C228486-060825
communications.communication:
Dear Elizabeth Haste, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C228486-060825 received on June 08, 2025 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV25-C228486-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C228486-060825. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV25-C228486-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

To download your records, please:

  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C228486-060825. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire.

If you have any follow-up questions or would like to initiate an administrative appeal under MDAR 17-0002 Section 6, please contact us within 10 business days after downloading your records, after which this request will no longer be monitored for communications. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Sincerely, 
Office of Economic Development

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502
(505) 476 6133
(505) 827-8030 fax



Confidentiality: The information contained in this e-mail and any attachment(s) hereto is confidential and may be legally privileged. This email and any attachment(s) is intended only for the recipient(s) identified above. If you are not one of the intended recipients, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this e-mail or its attachments is strictly prohibited. Unauthorized interception of this e-mail is a violation of federal law. If you have received this e-mail in error, please notify the sender by return e-mail and permanently delete the e-mail and any attachments to it immediately. Please do not retain, copy or use this e-mail or its attachments for any purpose, nor disclose all or any part of its contents to any other person.

New Mexico Educational Retirement Board

701 Camino De Los Marquez

June 5, 2023

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III."

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Julia Rock

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for your response! My name is Rebecca Burns and my colleague Julia Rock and I are reporters at The Lever, a national investigative outlet. I am making this request as part of ongoing reporting into water issues in the American West. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Illinois Freedom of Information Act. request, copied below, and originally submitted on Sept. 2, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: FOIA Request 25-1386
communications.communication:
September 9, 2025

Via electronic mail
Kelly North
MuckRock
192384-70293303@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:192384-70293303@requests.muckrock.com>

Re: FOIA Request 25-1386

Dear Kelly North:

      I am responding to your request dated and received in my office September 2, 2025, under the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) in which you requested:

      “…the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.”

      I am writing to invoke an extension of the deadline for responding to the request under the following section(s) of the FOIA, which allows for additional time when:


  *   140/3(e)(v) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions.

  *   140/3(e)(vi) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by paragraph (c) of this Section without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body.


      We are taking the additional five business days allowed by law to complete processing this request. The revised deadline will now be September 16, 2025.

Sincerely,

Adrienne Nazon
Vice President, External Relations and Communications
and Chief Records Officer

communications.subject: FOIA Request 25-1386
communications.communication:
September 12, 2025

Via electronic mail
Kelly North
MuckRock
192384-70293303@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:192384-70293303@requests.muckrock.com>

Re: FOIA Request 25-1386

Dear Kelly North:

      I am responding to your request dated and received in my office September 2, 2025, under the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) in which you requested from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign:

      “…the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.”

      Information responsive to your request is available. These are public records numbering 108 pages. Due to file size, the records referenced above are available for download at  https://uofi.box.com/s/bdo5pjnoyv5dkx4pptsjhwkclwi5jh2w. This link will expire in 10 business days. Because reading files in the Box interface can be slow and challenging, we suggest that you click the Download button to save your responsive file to your device.

Portions of these records have been redacted pursuant to the following section(s) of the Act:


  *   140/7(1)(b) that exempts from disclosure “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order.” This includes signatures and personal telephone numbers.



  *   140/7(1)(c) that exempts from disclosure “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which, if disclosed, would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information.” This includes State Registration Certificate numbers.


      Please note: The contract for Coca-Cola with the is the most recent contract available, though it expired June 29, 2025. There is no other current, fully executed Coca-Cola contract available at this time.

      You have a right under the law to seek a review of this response by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) in the Office of the Attorney General. The PAC may be reached by phone at 877.299.3642 or by postal mail to Leah Bartelt, Public Access Counselor, Office of the Illinois Attorney General, 500 South 2nd Street, Springfield, Illinois 62701. You also have the right to seek judicial review under section 11 of this Act.

      If you have questions for our office, please contact 217-333-6400.

                                                                                                  Sincerely,

                                                                                                  Adrienne Nazon
                                                                                                  Vice President, External Relations and
                                                                                                  Communications
                                                                                                  and Chief Records Officer

title: Banned books list (Texas Department of Criminal Justice)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Banned books list (Texas Department of Criminal Justice)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: PIR - Dillon Bergin - PIA No. 0380-09-2025
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The responsive information is attached. We now consider this request closed.

Thank you,

Office of the General Counsel - TDCJ
Phone: 936-437-6700

The information contained in this email and any attachments is intended for the exclusive use of the addressee(s) and may contain confidential, privileged, or proprietary information. Any other use of these materials is strictly prohibited. This email shall not be forwarded outside the Texas Department of Criminal Justice, Office of the General Counsel, without the permission of the original sender. If you have received this material in error, please notify me immediately by telephone and destroy all electronic, paper, or other versions.

title: LAUSD, SDUSD, and Fresno USD CSSP 4.23.25 (Los Angeles Unified School District)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: LAUSD, SDUSD, and Fresno USD CSSP 4.23.25 (Los Angeles Unified School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All finalized Comprehensive School Safety Plans submitted from 2018 to present in a word or .pdf file. I would also like a compiled excel sheet of all the Comprehensive School Safety Plans on Section 32282 reporting, specifically Section (M)(i) regarding "Procedures to respond to incidents involving an individual experiencing a sudden cardiac arrest or a similar life-threatening medical emergency while on school grounds."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sejal Parekh

communications.subject: Auto Reply
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email is in response to your California Public Records Act (PRA) request.  Your request will be reviewed and the appropriate departments contacted to determine if disclosable records relevant to your request exist.

As required under California Code section 7922.535(a), the Los Angeles Unified School District (District) will make a determination within 10 days as to whether or not a request is seeking records that are publicly disclosable and, if so, to provide the estimated date that the records will be made available.  There is no requirement for a public agency to actually produce the records within 10 days of receiving a request, unless the requested records are readily available.  Still, the District prides itself on always providing all publicly disclosable records in as timely a manner as possible.

Should you have any questions, please contact the Office of the General Counsel at (213) 241-7600.

Thank you.

PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS EMAIL.

communications.subject: 14-Day Ntc - MuckRock #48 - 4.24.2025 OGC Ctrl# 0101207
communications.communication:
Hello,

This correspondence is in response to your California Public Records Act Request received in the Office of the General Counsel on April 24, 2025, in which you requested the following:

*                     All finalized Comprehensive School Safety Plans submitted from 2018 to present in a word or .pdf file. I would also like a compiled excel sheet of all the Comprehensive School Safety Plans on Section 32282 reporting, specifically Section (M)(i) regarding "Procedures to respond to incidents involving an individual experiencing a sudden cardiac arrest or a similar life-threatening medical emergency while on school grounds."

Pursuant to California Government Code section 7922.535, the District is permitted to extend the date for responding under the following specified circumstances:

1.                  The District needs to search for and collect the requested records from field facilities or other establishments that are separate from the office processing the request.
2.                  The District needs to search for, collect and appropriately examine a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records that are demanded in the request.
3.                  The District may need to consult, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with two or more components of the agency having substantial subject matter interest therein.
4.                  The District may need to compile data.

In this regard, an extension is needed regarding the above-highlighted number(s).  The District will respond to your request no later than the close of business on May 19, 2025, with an estimated date and time when responsive records will be made available.

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.  Please indicate the above-referenced OGC Control number in any correspondence regarding this request.
Thank you.

communications.subject: MuckRock #48 - 4.24.2025 - OGC Ctrl# 0101207
communications.communication:
The Office of the General Counsel received your above referenced California Public Records Act (PRA) Request, which seeks the records listed below.  After conducting a diligent inquiry and making a thorough search of our records, the District responds as follows:

  1.  All finalized Comprehensive School Safety Plans submitted from 2018 to present in a word or .pdf file.
                        Please note this Request demands the Los Angeles Unified School District, which has 1,543 schools, provide over 10,000 reports.  Consequently, the records requested have been determined to be exempt pursuant to the following authority:

·                     "A clearly framed request which requires an agency to search an enormous volume of data . . . . or, conversely, a request which compels the production of a huge volume of material may be objectionable as unduly burdensome." California First Amendment Coalition v. Superior Ct. (1998) 67 Cal. App.4th 159, 166; citing American Civil Liberties Union Foundation v. Deukmejian (1982) 32 Cal.3d 440, 186. "[C]ourts should not ignore any expense and inconvenience involved in segregating [information]." California First Amendment Coalition v. Superior Ct. (1998) 67 Cal. App. 4th 159, 1326.  A public agency is not to be subjected to an "onerous burden" when disclosing public records. ACLU v. Deukmejian (1982) 32 Cal.3d 440, 454.



·                     Records sought would be exempt pursuant to Government Code §7927.000, which states: "An agency shall justify withholding any record by demonstrating that the record in question is exempt under express provisions of this division, or that on the facts of the particular case the public interest served by not disclosing the record clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure of the record."  "The CPRA provides for more than two dozen specific exemptions, including a "catchall" exemption (§ 6255) (now 7922.000). . . . Thus, the Act is clear that the Legislature intended to restrict the public's access to some material."  Regents of University of California v. Superior Court (2013) 222 Cal. App. 4th 383, 400.



·                     Pursuant to California Government Code section 7922.540(b), Christopher Harris, J.D., Senior Paralegal, Office of the General Counsel, Public Records Act Unit, is the person responsible for the redactions or determinations.


  1.  I would also like a compiled excel sheet of all the Comprehensive School Safety Plans on Section 32282 reporting, specifically Section (M)(i) regarding "Procedures to respond to incidents involving an individual experiencing a sudden cardiac arrest or a similar life-threatening medical emergency while on school grounds."
The District previously responded to this Request in the First Rolling Production.

With the production of the above response, the District has completed this matter.
Thank you for contacting the Los Angeles Unified School District Public Records Act Unit.



[A blue and red logo  Description automatically generated with low confidence]
Christopher Harris, J.D., Senior Paralegal
Los Angeles Unified School District, Office of General Counsel
333 S. Beaudry Avenue, 20th Floor
Los Angeles, California 90017
Phone:  (213) 241-7660
E-mail:  c.harris@lausd.net<mailto:c.harris@lausd.net>

P Please consider the environment before printing this e-mail.
This message, together with any attachments, is intended only for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed and may contain information that is legally privileged, confidential, or exempt from disclosure. If you have received this message in error, please notify the original sender immediately by telephone or by return e-mail and delete this message, along with any attachments, from your computer.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request 25CM534
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.), I respectfully request the following records:

All email communications or written correspondence authored or sent by Assistant State’s Attorney Mr. Covington to Judge Zimmerman that reference or pertain to Case No. 25-CM-534. This includes any emails or communications sent between January 1, 2025, and the date this request is fulfilled.

Additionally, I request:

Any other emails, letters, or internal communications between the Madison County State’s Attorney’s Office and Judge D. Zimmerman that discuss or refer to Case No. 25-CM-534, regardless of author or recipient, during the same time period.

Please include attachments, metadata, and any CC’d or BCC’d parties, where applicable. If any responsive documents are withheld in part or in full, I request that you provide the specific statutory exemption relied upon for each redaction or withholding, per 5 ILCS 140/9.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeffrey Luffman
